\addlegendentry{\footnotesize Raghavan}
%%
%% Below we fit power-laws to the community size distributions.  The exponent
%% alpha was derived using ntamas's program plfit, available at
%% GitHub:  https://github.com/ntamas/plfit
%%
%% BlondelEtAl2008
\addplot[black,domain=3:50,solid]
{
  3*x^(1 - 2.54133)  %% no editors; BlondelEtAl2008
  %% output from plfit
  %% Discrete MLE
  %% alpha =      2.54133
  %% xmin  =      3.00000
  %% L     =  -1802.44815
  %% D     =      0.04098
  %% p     =      0.12303
};
%% %%
%% %% ClausetEtAl2004
%% \addplot[black,domain=3:200,solid]
%% {
%%   (2.6)*x^(1 - 2.57305)  %% no editors; ClausetEtAl2004
%%   %% output from plfit
%%   %% Discrete MLE
%%   %% alpha =      2.57305
%%   %% xmin  =      3.00000
%%   %% L     =  -1781.85951
%%   %% D     =      0.03224
%%   %% p     =      0.35195
%% };
%%
%% RaghavanEtAl2007
\addplot[black,domain=5:40,dashed]
{
  (1.2)*x^(1 - 2.72632)  %% no editors; RaghavanEtAl2007
  %% output from plfit
  %% Discrete MLE
  %% alpha =      2.72632
  %% xmin  =      5.00000
  %% L     =  -1275.87211
  %% D     =      0.01860
  %% p     =      0.99519
};
\end{loglogaxis}
\end{tikzpicture}
\end{figure}
